title: Milano Map Typeface
content:
I am needing to identify the two fonts used on the cover of this old Italian Milano map.  
I am assuming "Milano" is a condensed version of the other font used, but I could be wrong.  
Any ideas are much appreciated. Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Map.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-07-17%20at%2010.40.12%20PM.png) | 199.8 KB |
author: lula123

comments.content:
Decided to treat the 2 fonts separately, look too different for me.  
Milano: close are [(DIN) Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/neuzeit-grotesk)/ [Geometric 706](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-706), [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova) Extra Condensed (playing with versions to get the single storey /a)  
PIANTA \* MAP \* PLAN (and the rest except MILANO): can't find a font that could match both lower and uppercases. Here are some you may find interesting though: [Planeta](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/gestalten/planeta_ot/ot_ps) (Plakat, /M and /I off), [CityOf](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.railfonts.com/cgi-bin/font_shop/fontshop.cgi?ACTION=enter&thispage=page10.html) (no lowercases), [Erbar](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/erbar) (Neo Mini but /a off), [Monod](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/monod), [Kessel 105](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/talbot/kessel-105), [(DIN) Neuzeit Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/neuzeit-grotesk)/ [Geometric 706](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-706) (not enough naive but family could work for both "Milano" and "PIANTA..."), [Ziamimi](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.typographyserved.com/gallery/ZIAMIMI-DAMIER-Free-Font/4154989) (no lowercases), [Nanami](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/nanami) (/M off), [Damian](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/i-can-be-your-type/damian) (/I and /G off mainly), [Ealing](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/ealing) (/M off), [Report School](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/report-school) (/M and /I off), [Alumia](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/alumia) (no lowercases), [Throne Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/Throne-Gothic-Typeface/8841207) (no lowercases, used to be sold at [Ten Dollar Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/)), [Diamonds](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/diamonds) (no lowercases), [Dupe](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/words-pictures/dupe), [Leberka](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/leberkaas-grotesk-typeface) (/G off), [Toronto Subway](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/toronto-subway) (/M and /G off), [Euclid](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/swisstypefaces.com/fonts/euclid-bp/all-styles), [Maax](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gautier/maax) (playing with alternates / [A](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gautier/maax/black/glyphs.html#glyphs/556264/353), / [M](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gautier/maax/black/glyphs.html#glyphs/556264/362) and/ [a](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828221148/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gautier/maax/black/glyphs.html#glyphs/556264/373), /G still off)
Wow, thank you Ryuk for your time and such insightful information! Some of these suggestions will definitely work. Thanks again!
